title: so with all these assassins and light carries building as juggernauts,

replies.body:
Its unfortunate that that item build might actually work. Once Assassins become tanky, it will become hard to balance them.

Maw might work better than Spirit though.
There's a reason duskblade was made. So assassins had their own set of items to balance them around. Instead of the using fighter items.
i think the juggernut build only works with champion who use aa as main dmg source, and has some sort of high dmg mechanic in their kit without scaling.

You don't need to build defensive items as Zed.
Enemy laner has to.

> Do I need to worry about tank Zed coming to my solo queue?

Probably not.

Zed has such amazing mobility and safety with mobility he'll always be able to rely on mobility to survive long enough to do his job, and building more damage makes his job easier.

A lot of assassins and light carries building tanky is more a response of them having a kit where they kill in 2 hits and die in 1, lacking the defensive tools necessary and being extremely risky to play in a way they do anything useful.
I mean: Akali's smoke cloud could already be countered extremely hard by anyone that just carried an extra Pink Ward around or ran with Red trinket, but Riot saw fit to nerf it to the point it's essentially useless outside of a 1v1 due to a lengthy activation time.
With no stealth to burst 100%-->50%, wait for CDs, burst 50%-->0%: Akali is simply in a sustained DPS zone where she can just take advantage of the fact MR is often 35%~50% lower than MR, especially in an AD heavy meta, and just be a sticky sustained-damage fighter that's OK rather than a garbage assassin with no defensive mechanics, backwards mobility, or burst.
Fiora is actually a fighter and her sustained DPS takes so long to unleash there isn't much of a reward for all the risk involved in building her as a glass-cannon. Riposte is handy for survival and so is Lunge, but it isn't exactly Zed's extreme levels of safety.

In most cases involving tanky builds: you get to deal more damage by living longer.
With Zed: pretty sure he still lives longer by killing things faster. With the backwards mobility on his ult shadow in particular, it's not like Zed is at a great risk of dying and the risk/reward is skewed in his kit strongly enough to benefit from tons of durability.
That Zed won't do nearly enough damage to kill anyone in a teamfight ever.
